get.summary: Get the current application settings
get.description: Get the current application settings

parameters.name: default_branch_protection
parameters.description: Determine if developers can push to master

parameters.name: restricted_visibility_levels
parameters.description: Selected levels cannot be used by non-admin users for projects or snippets. If the public level is restricted, user profiles are only visible to logged in users.

parameters.name: import_sources
parameters.description: Enabled sources for code import during project creation. OmniAuth must be configured for GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab.com

parameters.name: enabled_git_access_protocol
parameters.description: Allow only the selected protocols to be used for Git access.

parameters.name: gravatar_enabled
parameters.description: Flag indicating if the Gravatar service is enabled

parameters.name: default_projects_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of personal projects

parameters.name: session_expire_delay
parameters.description: Session duration in minutes. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

parameters.name: user_oauth_applications
parameters.description: Allow users to register any application to use GitLab as an OAuth provider

parameters.name: user_default_external
parameters.description: Newly registered users will by default be external

parameters.name: signup_enabled
parameters.description: Flag indicating if sign up is enabled

parameters.name: domain_whitelist
parameters.description: ONLY users with e-mail addresses that match these domain(s) will be able to sign-up. Wildcards allowed. Use separate lines for multiple entries. Ex: domain.com, *.domain.com

parameters.name: domain_blacklist_enabled
parameters.description: Enable domain blacklist for sign ups

parameters.name: domain_blacklist
parameters.description: Users with e-mail addresses that match these domain(s) will NOT be able to sign-up. Wildcards allowed. Use separate lines for multiple entries. Ex: domain.com, *.domain.com

parameters.name: signin_enabled
parameters.description: Flag indicating if sign in is enabled

parameters.name: require_two_factor_authentication
parameters.description: Require all users to setup Two-factor authentication

parameters.name: two_factor_grace_period
parameters.description: Amount of time (in hours) that users are allowed to skip forced configuration of two-factor authentication

parameters.name: home_page_url
parameters.description: We will redirect non-logged in users to this page

parameters.name: after_sign_out_path
parameters.description: We will redirect users to this page after they sign out

parameters.name: sign_in_text
parameters.description: The sign in text of the GitLab application

parameters.name: help_page_text
parameters.description: Custom text displayed on the help page

parameters.name: shared_runners_enabled
parameters.description: Enable shared runners for new projects

parameters.name: max_artifacts_size
parameters.description: Set the maximum file size each build's artifacts can have

parameters.name: metrics_port
parameters.description: The UDP port to use for connecting to InfluxDB

parameters.name: metrics_pool_size
parameters.description: The amount of InfluxDB connections to open

parameters.name: metrics_timeout
parameters.description: The amount of seconds after which an InfluxDB connection will time out

parameters.name: metrics_method_call_threshold
parameters.description: A method call is only tracked when it takes longer to complete than the given amount of milliseconds.

parameters.name: metrics_packet_size
parameters.description: The amount of points to store in a single UDP packet

parameters.name: sidekiq_throttling_queus
parameters.description: Choose which queues you wish to throttle

parameters.name: sidekiq_throttling_factor
parameters.description: The factor by which the queues should be throttled. A value between 0.0 and 1.0, exclusive.

parameters.name: recaptcha_enabled
parameters.description: Helps prevent bots from creating accounts

parameters.name: akismet_enabled
parameters.description: Helps prevent bots from creating issues

parameters.name: admin_notification_email
parameters.description: Abuse reports will be sent to this address if it is set. Abuse reports are always available in the admin area.

parameters.name: sentry_enabled
parameters.description: Sentry is an error reporting and logging tool which is currently not shipped with GitLab, get it here: https://getsentry.com

parameters.name: repository_checks_enabled
parameters.description: GitLab will periodically run 'git fsck' in all project and wiki repositories to look for silent disk corruption issues.

parameters.name: version_check_enabled
parameters.description: Let GitLab inform you when an update is available.

parameters.name: email_author_in_body
parameters.description: Some email servers do not support overriding the email sender name. Enable this option to include the name of the author of the issue, merge request or comment in the email body instead.

parameters.name: html_emails_enabled
parameters.description: By default GitLab sends emails in HTML and plain text formats so mail clients can choose what format to use. Disable this option if you only want to send emails in plain text format.

parameters.name: housekeeping_enabled
parameters.description: Enable automatic repository housekeeping (git repack, git gc)

parameters.name: housekeeping_bitmaps_enabled
parameters.description: Creating pack file bitmaps makes housekeeping take a little longer but bitmaps should accelerate 'git clone' performance.

parameters.name: housekeeping_incremental_repack_period
parameters.description: Number of Git pushes after which an incremental 'git repack' is run.

parameters.name: housekeeping_full_repack_period
parameters.description: Number of Git pushes after which a full 'git repack' is run.

parameters.name: housekeeping_gc_period
parameters.description: Number of Git pushes after which 'git gc' is run.
